sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Israeli military say a conducted airstrike targeted and killed Islamic Jihad group leader Khaled Mansour as cross-border tensions continue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The UN nuclear watchdog chief says there's a very real risk of nuclear disaster after Ukraine's Zaporizhia nuclear plant was hit by shelling.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Protesters took to the streets in two separate marches in Italy yesterday to demand justice for the killing of a Nigerian street vendor by an Italian man.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: An Israeli airstrike killed a senior commander in the Palestinian militant group the Islamic Jihad.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The fighters said on Sunday their second leader to be slain amid an escalating cross-border conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Recent fighting has killed at least 32 Palestinians and seen hundreds of rockets fired.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The leader in question who was targeted and struck was Khaled Mansour, who led the Iranian-backed Islamic Jihad operations in the southern Gaza Strip.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Palestinian militants have retaliated to the Israeli airstrikes with a barrage of their own rockets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: According to health authorities in the Palestinian territory, six children were among those killed in the attacks since the, quote, Israeli aggression Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But Israel said it had irrefutable evidence that a stray rocket from Islamic Jihad militants had been responsible for the death of multiple children in Jabalia in northern Gaza on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's not immediately clear how many children were killed in the incident in Jabalia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Israeli Prime Minister Yair Lapid held a security cabinet meeting on Saturday night, warning deadly aerial operations against militants in Gaza could last a week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And the worst violence between Israel and Palestine since the 11-day war in 2021.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Smoke rising from Ukraine's Zaporizhia nuclear plant, the biggest in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Their concerns after it was hit by shelling, causing one of the reactors to be shut down.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Moscow and Kyiv are blaming each other for the incident Ukrainian president Vladimir Zelensky says the situation is serious to use the plant for terror. We will bring the world's attention to that and insist on new sanctions against Russia for creating such global threat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: UN nuclear watchdog chief Rafael Grossi says there's a very real risk of nuclear disaster and wants IAEA experts to be allowed to inspect the damage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And EU foreign policy chief Joseph Borrell tweeted that military activity around the plant was a serious breach of nuclear safety rules.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In other news, Ukraine says Russian forces yesterday began an assault on two key cities in the eastern Donetsk region and kept up rocket and shelling attacks on other Ukrainian cities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Deputy mayor of the Russian-occupied city of Novokarkovka in the Kherson region has died in hospital after being shot. Meanwhile two of three more ships that are carrying thousands of tons of corn from Ukraine have anchored north of Istanbul awaiting inspection. The Maltese flagged Russian destined for the United Kingdom arrived shortly after the Navistar which is heading towards Ireland. A third freighter made the reverse journey arriving at the port of Charnomorsk for loading grain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Taiwan's premier Su Seng Chang says China has arrogantly used military actions to disrupt regional peace and stability.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Chinese military exercises around the island are set to wrap up on Sunday, but Beijing has announced fresh drills in the Yellow Sea, located between China and the Korean Peninsula, to take place next week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Furthermore, Chinese diplomats continue their campaign to lay the blame on the US for causing chaos in the region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: On Saturday, China's Foreign Ministry spokesperson Hua Chunying accused the US of interfering in Beijing's internal affairs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: She added that Washington should have stopped Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan last week. The United States, on the other hand, has accused Beijing of being provocative and irresponsible. Almost half the global container fleet, nearly 90 percent of the world's largest ships, passed through the Taiwan Strait this year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Since their missile launches, Beijing has taken an irresponsible step of a different kind.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: They shut down eight different areas where our two countries have been able to work together. Meanwhile, Chinese State Councilor and Foreign Minister Wang Li met on Friday with Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov with Russia backing China's one China principle. A massive fire is still raging

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: uncontrolled at an oil storage facility in Cuba, set off by a lightning strike on Friday night.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: One person has died, 17 firefighters are missing and 120 others were injured following four explosions at the Matanzas supertanker base.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The government says it's asked for help from experts from friendly countries with experience in the oil sector.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: from friendly countries with experience in the oil sector.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Authorities in Iceland say noxious gases from a volcano that's erupted near the capital Reykjavik threatens to pollute air in the city which is just 40 km away.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They say concentrations of sulphur dioxide could reach a level considered unhealthy for the sensitive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Despite warnings for people to avoid the site, visitors have been flocking to see its lava flow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: French authorities are working around the clock to try and free a dangerously thin beluga whale that has strayed into the Seine River in France. The lost mammal was first spotted on Tuesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: By Saturday, it had made its way about 70 kilometers north of Paris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Rescuers have tried to feed the whale, but it's so far refused, sparking fears it could slowly starve in the waterway and die.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Protesters took to the streets of Civitanovo, Marche in Italy yesterday to demand justice

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: for the killing of a Nigerian street vendor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Two marches, one attended by Alika Orko Chukwe's widow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Her husband was beaten to death in the well-to-do Adriatic beach town by an Italian man with a documented history of mental illness.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A widely circulated video by one witness shows the aggressor wrestling Orko Chukwe to the ground and strangling him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Organizers of the first march said they did not want the search for justice to be clouded by accusations of racism that they feel cannot be proven.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: However, a second march organized by black Italians along the same route called on authorities to recognize the role of race in the incident.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Several witnesses filmed the July 29th assault but failed to physically intervene, adding a layer of public outrage over apparent indifference.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: People have left flowers and notes of condolences on the sidewalk where Orgo Chukwe died.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Snapshots of life in Pompeii continue to emerge as archaeologists uncover new artifacts at the site that's been frozen in time since Mount Vesuvius erupted in 79 AD.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Some of the more remarkable objects found include perfectly preserved bowls and dishware, along with a three-legged accent table that looks surprisingly modern. Here we can see the cabinet with the wooden part of the doors and these are the supports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We had to imagine they were positioned this way to allow the cabinet to open.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Inside the cabinet there were shelves and what we see is this shelf collapse when the volcano erupted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Inside we find glass objects, like these bottles, but also ceramic, like these vases, that we are gradually discovering.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The recently excavated rooms in the ancient city shed light on how the middle classes lived.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: While past excavations have generally focused on Pompeii's wealthiest, more and more research is being dedicated to its middle and lower classes, including enslaved people and servants.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: There's no street nor statue in his honor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: For many, the social footprint of former president of Yugoslavia, Josef Broz Tito, is a delicate subject.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But now, a new walking tour in Croatia's capital, Zagreb, is hoping to trace the leader's complicated legacy in a city where he remains divisive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We still have heated debate, even 42 years after Tito has died.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: So the aim of the tour is to try to normalize the debate, because we cannot not acknowledge that Tito was one of the political giants of the 20th century.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The tour does not sugarcoat the past.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Tour guide Daniela Matyrievich explores Tito's ability to keep ethnic tensions under control, while also discussing his authoritarian regime and poor human rights record.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: For tourists, it's something different.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I wanted to hear some things that are maybe not known, that are not talked about.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's something new in Zagreb, instead of just seeing the cathedral, the stone gate and other tourist attractions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The Walk with Tito tour takes people to eight sites in downtown Zagreb linked to the Croatian-born leader and the anti-Fascist movement he founded at the start of World War II, commonly known as the Partisans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It also stops at the square once named after the leader, as well as his former residency.
